review: Bah√≠a Inglesa may be the only beaching Chile that looks like a Caribbean one i.e white sand and turquoise and clear waters. It is very nice for a day of sun at the beach. However, the water is very cold? (16-18 degrees centigrade).There is boardwalk that borders the beach with a few hotels and many restaurants.Eating at Bahia Inglesa is not cheap.

Tiny beach definitely worth visiting. We went from copiapo to caldera with a bus which departed from the buss terminal next to the Lider (supermarket) for 3.500 CLP. From Caldera we took a collectivo to 1.000 CLP to Bahia Inglesa.

Just down the road from Caldera is this gorgeous beach with its white sands and turquoise waters. This is the South Pacific so the water is COLD. Too cold for us to dip in in early April but several brave souls did! Amongst the sand are black rocks that give the bay character but rock shoes are by no means necessary. It gets a bit windy but never too cold to lie and sunbathe in the strong light. Parking is free along the esplanade and there are several restaurants. There is a boardwalk from the road into the beach and is suitable for wheelchair users as well. The beach was clean when we visited. No litter anywhere. But there are several stray dogs, though not vicious but rather friendly and playful (if a bit mangy). This is a great place to spend a day and one of the most beautiful beaches in Chile. Definitely recommended.

A 2 star hotel. Is highly rated as Copiapo hardly have any nice hotel. Wifi no presence at all in the room. It has a nice pool but too cold for me to dare to try :) Breakfast no where near Hotel Casino Antay and front desk service is poor. However in Copiapo, you really cannot expect great service in general. You're lucky if they speed things up for you. Overall, is only a nice 1 day stopover after many days in mountains to have a good shower. Lots of resto nearby.

We went there in the spring (October), and it was totally dead, even on a Friday! Some restaurants were open, but all hostels were closed. Therefore there is nothing to do. I really don't recommend it outside the high season.

My boyfriend and I drove here expecting beautiful turquoise shores and what we found was an extremely crowded and touristy sea front with some white sand but no turquoise waters. We ended up driving south down the coast where we found more beautiful and completely deserted beaches. Disappointed in Bahia Inglesa.

Got the bus from Copiapo(bus station is located next to Lider supermarket) to Caldera which took about 1hr.At Caldera you can take a collectivo or taxi to Bahia inglesa.Its about 5kms ride and may cost between 1000-2000 pesos each way.I  was there in the low season so the place was quiet,but had a few restaurants and cafes open.I suggest eating in Caldera where you have better choices of restaurants and slightly lower prices too.

On our way from the San Francisco Pass to Atacama, we decided not to try our luck with Copiap√≥ hotels and headed straight for Bah√≠a Inglesa, on the Pacific Coast. While definitely a pure tourist town, its restaurants and hotels offer seaside views, a relaxing atmosphere, and it is possible to explore both, inland desert landscapes and nearby beaches.

I was greatly surprised when I discovered this place with my family, on vacation. It was so pleasant to know that we could enjoy that small paradise in a really peaceful way, a perfect option to avoid crowds. There the sand is really clear and the water is very crystalline, even turquoise, and also  warmer than most of the chilean coast. In addition to that, you can try some scuba diving classes, which I totally recommend too.

Bahia Inglesa is a small, laid back beach village where a stroll along the front gives you white sand beach, cafes, bars and restaurants - not too many - a dive school and a couple of hotels. The pace of life is very leisurely.We spent two nights here and could easily have slowed down to spend a week ; a delight.
preciosa de aguas cristalinas y mar tranquilo! me encanto, lo unico malo es que como es chica se llena muy rapido de gente, no recomendable ir en febreto
Estaba muy llena la playa, los que van llegando no respetan tu espacio, y ahora con la pandemia, es muy desagradable. Ya no es como antes.

Es un hermoso lugar, de lejos parece una playa caribe√±a. Lo malo es que est√° muy sucia la arena. El municipio no se encarga de mantener la playa. Esta llena de algas que la gente amontona y expelen un fuerte olor desagradable, para que decir lo que deja la gente (mascarillas, latas, vasos, colilla de cigarro, etc). Se llena mucho, creo que en enero y febrero debe ser intransitable. Otra cosa negativa es que fuman mucha marihuana, no hay control de la marina en esta playa.
Crec√≠ visitando Algarrobo desde que nac√≠, pero han deteriorado tanto esta playa, desde que construyeron los edificios no es lo mismo, y cada a√±o crece el exceso de gente.
Una hermosa playa con vistas inigualables,un buen lugar para visitar , para compartir en familia... con muchas ofertas , bueno para caminar y desextresarse...
si uno quiere ir hay que estacionar el auto bien lejos y bajar por un bosque y escaleras, llegar no es tan complicado, sino volver al auto facilmente 40 minutos para bajar y una hora para subir
Es una playa donde se puede ba√±ar y disfrutar mucho en familia. Es linda y bastante tranquila. Hay que asistir temprano pues se suele llenar muy r√°pido

Lugar con gran potencial para el turismos. Hermosa! Hay que pasar un bosque para bajar al mar. Hay estacionamiento, ba√±os, vendedores, banana etc lo malo es que va demasiada gente al punto de que no se puede ni caminar y no se aprecia el mar por tantos tapasoles. El agua es helada.  Volver√© pero no en estas fechas.

La playa es muy linda, paisaje espectacular, aguas cristalinas, caminer√≠a que te lleva a una santuario de aves muy lindo, ahora viene lo no tan bueno, fuimos en febrero y al principio como hasta las 14:00 estaba ok, pero despu√©s de esta hora se llen√≥ al l√≠mite que no cab√≠a ni un tapasol m√°s, afortunadamente como llegamos temprano escogimos un lugar por donde no nos pasaba la gente por encima pero era casi imposible caminar sin pisar una toalla. En conclusi√≥n si quieres relajarte y tener un d√≠a de paz en definitiva este no es el lugar...al menos no en esta √©poca

Segundo a√±o consecutivo que voy, a la playa y es imposible encontrar un lugar para poner nuestras cosas. Realmente impresionante la cantidad de gente. Ya no es lo que sol√≠a ser antes, una playa agradable y de descanso. Al final de cuentas NOS FUIMOS

Cavancha es la playa ubicada en pleno centro de la ciudad de Iquique. Se encuentra a metros del espacio urbano de Iquique.

Al sur de esta cierra la gran bah√≠a la pen√≠nsula de Cavancha. En el lugar convergen 25 restaurantes una torre de 35 pisos de altura, m√°s otras en construcci√≥n, pub, restaurantes tem√°ticos y resto-bares.
Excelente lugar para la familia. Playa Cavancha y Brava para realizar deporte. Mall Zofri para comprar perfumes-tragos y chocolates.Baquedano, un buen lugar para comer.
Lleno de quitasoles que arriendan, no dejan espacio para poner el quitasol que uno trae, y si uno se pone cerca del quitasol que se arrienda, el due√±o te trata p√©simo..
Es una playa amplia con muchas actividades para todos los gustos.  Salvavidas y segura Un poco cochina. Hartas deportes para hacer
Excelente playa donde puedes caminar libre en el mejor lugar. Adoro mis playas nortinas no las cambio por nada muy recomendado
Muy buena playa,  bien cuidada, limpia y el paseo peatonal, excelente para pasear tanto de dia como de noche. dos paseos peatonales y una ciclovia.   muy hermosa.
Bajamos a la playa. bastante mas limpia que hace 4 a√±os atras. El gran problema que tiene es el comercio ambulante permanete, vendiendo de todo, licor, cigarrilllos, comida, choclo, etc.

Puedes realizar largas caminatas, disfrutando de juegos, fotos, peque√±os museos con animales y amfibios. Puedes disfrutar de comida al paso de todos los presios. Y si quieres nadar, mucha playa para ti.

Sitio muy bonito para correr en la ma√±ana y luego disfrutar con la familia, el agua un poco fr√≠a pero normal por estos lados. Hay servicios de toldos y sillas en toda la playa, hay zona de actividades deportivas y duchas para sacarse la arena antes de partir. El atardecer muy agradable.

Playa totalmente llena, muchos ni√±os jugando en la orilla, armando sus torres, fortalezas. El mar agradable (ni tibio ni fr√≠o). Arriendan quitasoles y sillas. Y venden helados, agua, bebidas, palmeras, etc.....Y m√°s!!!...mojitos, hamburguesas, papas fritas, frutas...es incre√≠ble. En el borde sur arriendan kayacs. En la ma√±ana es para ir tranquilo a tomar sol con poca gente (pero venden lo mismo!!!)
Con vista a los botecitos de pescadores y la pen√≠nsula. cerca del casino. Hay bastantes servicios de comida, reposeras y ba√±os p√∫blicos. En la semana es m√°s tranquila que  los fines de semana.

Es un lugar hermoso, que provoca volver cada d√≠a. Fuimos a ver el amanecer y fue totalmente incre√≠ble y maravilloso. Un lugar tranquilo y hermoso. Ver los surfistas es entretenido y todas las vistas son magnificas.

Lugar precioso con vistas al Pac√≠fico de postal. El camino para llegar es complicado pero la fauna Silvestre que se deja ver constantemente hacen que valga la pena. Le falta infraestructura tur√≠stica que es muy b√°sica.
Cafes, foodtrucks, alojamientos, restaurantes, artesan√≠a, fotograf√≠a, trekking. Para ir en pareja, familia, amigos.
Un lugar maravilloso, donde puedes reconectar con la naturaleza y renovar tu  energ√≠a. Es el lugar indicado para pensar y disfrutar de la magnificencia del oceano
Fuimos de paseo primero para conocer los acantilados y despu√©s fuimos a la playa. Nos encant√≥ lo grande que es, ideal para caminar.
En un lugar magico ,muy bien cuidado y la panoramica es espectacular , para sacar las mejores fotos imperdible
Lindo paisaje, hay la posiblidad de hacer hermosas fotos en la playa y en el sendero, el atardecer es maravilloso.
hermoso lugar, magico ver a cada surfista , bell√≠simo espect√°culo, la puesta de sol omperdible, debes ir  sin falta y solo respirar el encanto.

Pararse en los miradores de Punta de Lobos a observar los cactus que van como bajando hacia un encuentro con la llegada de las olas, observar y escuchar las relajadas  gaviotas y ver a los surfistas apoderados del placer de estar abrazados a sus multicolores  tablas de surf esperando las mejores olas, y todo esto con un divino sunset, fue para mi un conjunto de bonitas experiencias y momentos muy especiales.
Linda vista, lugar hermoso para hscer fotos y pasar una tarde agradable. No apto para el ba√±o. Buenos lugares para dormir y comer cercanos

Primera vez en la zona. Vi√±a me gust√≥, Re√±aca me gust√≥ mucho mas, linda costanera para caminar, playas mas extensas, un lindo centro con un polo gastr√≥nomico, me pareci√≥ de mas nivel que Vi√±a. Recomendable al menos para caminar en lindas tardes de invierno. Ya lo visitaremos en verano....

Re√±aca est√° ubicada al norte de la comuna de vi√±a del mar, en la regi√≥n de Valpara√≠so. Este lugar es uno de los m√°s exclusivos, tanto en el √°mbito tur√≠stico, como residencial. Se caracteriza por su extensa playa, por lo pintoresco, por lo agradable que es al momento de querer ir de paseo por la orilla del mar, la diversidad en locales, la amabilidad de su gente, y bueno, tambi√©n por sus diversos precios, pero sinceramente vale la pena realizar un viaje aqu√≠, ya que tienes un ambiente limpio, agradable, tranquilo, seguro. Cabe destacar el trabajo de los salvavidas, que es muy profesional y eficiente.El ambiente es fant√°stico para pasarlo en familia, es acogedor, seguro y tranquilo. Asi tambi√©n, como seria para un grupo de amigos o una junta familiar de primos, se puede disfrutar de buenas olas para hacer surf, y luego relajarse tranquilamente a tomar un poco de luz solar.Lo √∫nico que quiz√°s juega un poquito en contra, es lo frio del agua, pero fuera de ese detalle, este lugar es perfecto para venir a relajarse y disfrutar en familia o con amigos.

Hace a√±os que venimos a esta playa, claramente, entre marzo y diciembre es tranquila y buena para estar con los ni√±os. Enero y febrero esta llena, mucha bulla y para encontrar un estacionamiento debes tener suerte. Hay variedades para comer, y se puede caminar durante la tarde-noche tranquilos.

La playa est√° generalmente limpia y es espaciosa, el oleaje es muy fuerte.Punto positivo el trabajo de los salva vidas, est√°n muy pendientes de la seguridad de los turistas todo el tiempo.Negativo es que en el sector 5 el ruido de las discotecas es fuerte.
Es amplia, limpia y linda. Sin dudas la mejor de toda la zona. Solo tener cuidado con el mar, que adem√°s de fr√≠o es bastante revuelto a veces.
Lindas playas , tienen cartel de prohibido ba√±arse, no se porque la gente se mete igualtoda la costa hasta vi√±a lleno de paradores, muy lindos
Linda playa para caminar, para tomar sol y divertirse. Existen distintos paradores para tomar caf√© o comer.

Bonita playa,para descansar, tranquilo en familia,con muchos sectores, no es apta para ba√±arte muy adentro porque sus marejadas son fuertes y altas, y tiene corrientes .Solo debes seguir indicaciones de los encargados, cuenta con salvavidas, zonas de ba√±o, para arrendar quitasoles,hamacas , esterillas.Cafeter√¨as y restorantes,polic√≠a siempre atenta y vigilancia naval

Creo que es la √∫nica buena playa de Vi√±a, aunque sea un lugar muy profundo y con olas muy fuertes (y peligrosas). Aguas muy fr√≠as, por supuesto...Un kil√≥metro de arena costera en donde hay de todo, paradores donde comprar comidas y bebidas,quioscos, ba√±os a CLP 500, sombrillas y reposeras para alquilar, Un lindo lugar para pasar los d√≠as y por que no las noches.Una situaci√≥n complicada es el estacionamiento. Sumamente dif√≠cil de encontrar las tardes de poca gente y una quimera encontrarlo los fines de semana en temporada. Si van a hospedarse en Re√±aca que sea en lugares cercanos a la playa o sin pendiente, como para ir caminando. El auto es un verdadero problema.
Playas muy tranquilas y limpias, con seguridad! Adem√°s de las playas, tienes locales comerciales que no te puede faltar nada!

Malaaaaaa, Playa chica, llena de rocas Malos ba√±os y pocos , fila para hacer del 1 Gastronom√≠a , regulequeLugar, feo sin dep√≥sitos para basura , saturado el acceso a estacionamientos etc etc etc En resumen , perd√≠ un d√≠a de mis pocos que tuve

La playa en si es un espect√°culo. Lo que es TERRIBLE es que la gente no respeta espacio personal, ni siquiera en pandemia. Llegamos temprano y nos alejamos de la entrada con la esperanza de tener a personas lejos. A eso de las 13:00 se llen√≥ por completo la playa. Imposible escapar de tanta gente. Nos insultaron y trataron horrible. NO RECOMIENDO IR

Es una hermosa playa, la facilidad para estacionarse a un costado de ella en la isla es a un costo razonable, con  arena blanca y postal muy paradisiaca, lugares donde comer y arriendo de quitasol si se te olvida, pero no volvere a ir nunca mas, esta playa solo posee una doble via de acceso, solo un camino, el d√≠a 15 de enero de este a√±o sono la alerta de tsunami en la region de coquimbo, estabamos en el agua con los ni√±os y salir se volvio un caos, nunca sent√≠ ese p√°nico en mi vida. la sirena de la playa y los celulares de todos sonando al unisono con la frase "evacuar palya, alerta de tsunami regi√≥n de coquimbo"quedara grabado en mi memoria, salir por ese camino se volvio eterno y lleno de miedo.El d√≠a en que hagan otras vias de evacuaci√≥n pensare en volver a ir, si la ola hubiese sido mas grande y cercana al momento de la alerta, estariamos todos muertos.

El lugar es hermoso, pero la intervenci√≥n humana lo ha hecho horrible. La playa llena de autos, m√∫sica fuerte, gente haciendo asados y comiendo, matando erizos y estrellas. Horrible, no volver√≠a nunca, nos sentimos muy inc√≥modos y es muy triste no ver ni si quiera aves, contaminaci√≥n total, no hay si quiera un basurero

Es un lugar maravilloso y paradisiaco. El entorno maravilloso y el agua calidad, lo unico malo es la cantidad de gente que asiste para ser un espacio tan reducido... jaja no se trata de querer la playa para mi sola, pero como a las 4 subi√≥ la marea y quedamos todos amontonados... hubo que salir casi arrancando de donde est√°bamos y colocar las cosas demasiado cerca (por nondecir casi encima) de los demas.
Es una de mis playas favoritas en Chile, nada que envidiarle al Caribe; arenas blancas, agua refrescante y olas perfectas para nadar, jugar o sufear. Totalmente recomendable.

Playa de un azul muy lindo, no es taan helada, y cuenta con gran variedad de restaurantes y venta de ceviches. Todos muy ricos y a excelente precio (ceviche para 1 persona 2.000 pesos Empanadas de 1.500 a 2.500 Almuerzo reineta m√°s 2 contornos 7.000)Ba√±os limpios por 400 pesos Llegar temprano (11-12 del medio dia) o antes si el d√≠a amanece soleado. Se llena bastante, por favor recordar siempre medidas contra el COVID.

Playa muy bonita, estaba muy lleno pero igual fue agradable. Por favor pongan basureros para que las personas se vean en la obligaci√≥n de no botar basura al suelo, que lamentablemente ir√° a parar al mar. Los ni√±os lo pasaron bien.

Playa de arena blanca (no conchilla), playa muy plana, aguas heladas (como toda la costa chilena), rica para el ba√±o. Playa muy bonita. Agua turquesa y para nada fr√≠a.Mucha gente. No recomiendo comprar en el local pricsy muy caro y todo lo extra como ensaladas, cuesta el 300 % mas y no vale la pena.Mejor opcion  es comer en la costanera en los locales chicos.Todo lo demas super

Llegamos al camping el lunes 21 de febrero muy tarde (son varias horas de viaje ) pero el se√±or que nos atendi√≥ muy amable. El lugar es hermoso, el camping siempre muy ordenado y limpio, los sitios  c√≥modos y con todo lo necesario, (solo tiene luz el sector de la mesa del sitio, la cual es suficiente para el sitio. Para ir al ba√±o o lavar la loza debes llevar linterna en caso que sea muy tarde. Pero se agradece y espero se mantenga el camping con el concepto de disfrutar la naturaleza, el cielo por las noches se ve realmente HERMOSO) Tengo  una observaci√≥n importante que realizar y espero que haya sido que el ba√±o que nos toco (20) no estaba funcionando el agua temperada (se que no hay Calefont) PERO DICEN QUE ES AGUA TEMPERATURA AMBIENTE, PERO NOS SALI√ì EL AGUA MUY FR√çA INCLUSO EL AGUA DONDE SE LAVAN LA LOZA SAL√çA MUCHO   M√ÅS TEMPERADA (Se notaba mucho la diferencia) (Tengo la esperanza que haya sido un desperfecto, por que nos encantar√≠a volver) Saludos y gracias por el servicio !!!
Hermosa playa de arenas blancas, oleaje tranquilo y agua no tan fr√≠a .Vale la pena lo dif√≠cil del acceso , ojal√° se mantenga as√≠ piolita disfrutamos un lindo d√≠a con los ni√±os

Sin duda alguna, Playa La Virgen es la mejor playa de Chile. Alojar en el camping es conectarse con la naturaleza, disfrutar del sol y del silencio del desierto y sentir el sonido relajante del mar en todo momento. La experiencia es √∫nica, por eso volvemos cada vez que podemos.100% recomendable
Muy buena experiencia en Playa La Virgen, excelente  el camping, recomendable 1000%, volver√© si o si!!!

Lugar paradis√≠aco, muy bueno el camping, muy buena disposici√≥n de la recepcionista a todas nuestras consultas. El sitio y los ba√±os impecables. Un lugar ideal para ir  a relajarse y disfrutar de la hermosa playa que recuerda al caribe.

Soy campista regular de esta playa, visit√°ndola casi ininterrumpidamente en carpa o combi varias veces por temporada hace unos 10 a√±os.El acceso (por el desv√≠o pr√≥ximo a Puerto Viejo) est√° transitable para casi cualquier veh√≠culo, de hecho lo podemos hacer en nuestra combi sin problemas.La playa en general es de oleaje tranquilo, sin grandes peligros para ni√±os.Los sitios de camping son de buen tama√±o, alejados entre si, en general con linda vista a la playa y acantilado del otro sector.Los ba√±os de cada sitio son muy c√≥modos (a√∫n cuando quedan alejados de algunos sitios). La ducha a temperatura ambiente en verano es bakan.!La fogata en la noche sin se√±al de celular, y en general con visitantes respetuosos del silencio es espectacular, tanto en las noches con luna como las sin luna.En resumen, uno de los mejores lugares de playa en chile, al menos para acampar.

Amo el camping de playa la virgen.La desconexi√≥n es plena, yo fui con mi familia, adem√°s tener ba√±o privado, poder compartir una fogata de noche, no tiene precio! Es volver a lo simple, es u√±a experiencia impagable Es uno mejores camping del norte! Espero que todos cuidemos este lugar, no s√≥lo depende de los administradores, nosotros que visitamos ese lugar, debemos cuidarlo! Debemos partir por nosotros ü•∞ Una maravilla del norte
Espectacular estad√≠a, caba√±a de lujo, limpia, con mucho espacio y vista inmejorable. Un placer pasar unos d√≠as all√≠. 100% recomendado.

Un lugar m√°gico, limpio, bien cuidado (no permiten ni m√∫sica alta en la playa, una maravilla) y muy bien organizado (camping, caba√±as, restaurant, etc.) en el  mas amplio sentido de la palabra, puedes bucear, pescar, hacer trekking, andar en bicicleta, etc.¬°¬°¬°Felicitaciones a la administraci√≥n y su personal por tanto cari√±o para cuidar a los que queremos descansar y disfrutar en familia¬°¬°¬°.

Este a√±o fue la segunda vez que veraneamos en el camping de Playa La Virgen y nuevamente nos arrepentimos de no haber reservado por m√°s d√≠as. El camping tiene de todo para poder desconectarse y no tener que moverse de ah√≠. Cada sitio cuenta con su ba√±o privado, mesa, techo, luz, cargador USB, parrilla y fog√≥n. Puedes comprar le√±a, carb√≥n y hielo en recepci√≥n y guardar cosas en los congeladores que tienen disponibles (sin gratis, alguna gente acapara espacio, quiz√°s falta uno m√°s)Llevar unos power bank o bater√≠a externa no es mala idea considerando que s√≥lo hay enchufe USB (es el desierto. Hay que cuidar el agua y la electricidad). No hay se√±al de celular y para nosotros eso es lo mejor! Pero es un punto a considerar.La amabilidad del staff, la preocupaci√≥n constante porque uno est√© c√≥modo, y todo el ambiente del camping hacen que sea inolvidable. Se puede salir a caminar por el desierto y ver unos atardeceres incre√≠bles y en la noche prender el fog√≥n y tomarse algo viendo ese cielo completamente estrellado. Corre viento a veces entre la tarde-noche. Yo soy media friolenta as√≠ que igual llevo parka y bototos. Tambi√©n es buena idea llevar repelente. Hay muy buena onda en el camping. Es s√∫per familiar pero no quita que uno disfrute de su m√∫sica y tomarse algo en la noche. Hay mucho respeto de los espacios y nadie hace tremendos carretes, o al menos nosotros no hemos tenido ese tema. Es un lugar que para nosotros significa descanso seguro.El a√±o 2021 la playa estaba menos llena que este verano pero se entiende ya que estamos en etapas distintas de plan paso a paso y todo eso. Este a√±o nosotros baj√°bamos temprano y cero drama, siempre ten√≠amos un lugar donde ponernos c√≥modamente. Agradecemos infinitamente el cari√±o de todo el staff de recepci√≥n, de Administraci√≥n y de todos en el camping! Son lo m√°ximo y nos vemos el 2023!

La playa de zapallar es √∫nica, una de las m√°s lindas de chile. Depende el d√≠a puedes nadar por la playa hasta la balsa, ver toninas o almorzar en el chiringuito.Est√° prohibidos los coolers y los animales!! Para que tengan ojo con eso. Se paga el estacionamiento, es mejor estacionarse en otro lado y caminar
es mi refugio, mi casa desde mi ni√±ez.... adorooooooo este lugarrrr,, que rico caminar en caminitos de piedra,,, lo amo
No hay tanta gente como en otras playas. Muy limpia de arena dorada y excelente vista.Hay estacionamientos dipsonible los que se deben pagar.
Linda vista y lugar tranquilo. Un excelente balneario para pasar el fin de semana y disfrutar con la familia

Zapallar tiene una playa muy linda con senderos tranquilos. Hay posibilidad de nadar sin problemas, incluso tiene una plataforma dentro del agua. Tuvimos la suerte de ver una tonina cerca de la costa y tambi√©n es posible ver ping√ºinos cerca. Existe un sendero que conecta Zapallar con Cachag√ºa y es un excelente paseo dentro de la zona.

Puedes disfrutar su playa con tranquilidad; arriendas ah√≠ mismo quitasol y si tienes ni√±os ellos pueden disfrutar tambi√©n del mar en tu compa√±√≠a. Si el d√≠a est√° m√°s fr√≠o, tienes la oportunidad de hacer lindas caminatas por las veredas que salen desde la misma playa y van bordeando el mar.
Excelente playa, ideal para nadar y pasar el d√≠a.Cuenta con ba√±os, estacionamientos y restauran.Recomendada
Preocupaci√≥n por el cliente, muy buena atenci√≥n. Estacionamiento disponible y personal muy amable. Buena Elecci√≥n de carta.
La playa me encanto, s√∫per limpia, tranquila y agradable el ambiente. Tiene los servicios de ba√±o, arriendo de toldo, estacionamiento.
Es una playa peque√±a muy acogedora, limpia las personas que circunda tu alrededor son respetuosas de tu espacio

Bah√≠a Inglesa es un lindo lugar, puedes quedarte a alojar ah√≠ y luego recorrer todas las playas que existen alrededor. La Virgen, Bah√≠a Cisne, Rodillo por ejemplo. . Vale la pena ir a la mina San Jos√© y a unos minutos, visitar el mar de dunas. Excelente clima, buenos caminos. No olvide llevarse la basura, eso es algo que caracteriza a estos paisajes, la gente no los cuida.
Muy rica playa, harto comercio, aunque harta gente para el espacio que hay, costanera bonita, harto donde comer. En la tarde corre bastante viento.

Hace algunos a√±os hice una gran publicaci√≥n sobre este lugar, sin embargo en esta ocasi√≥n solo debo destacar su paseo hasta la playa las machas y los juegos al final de este. De la playa en si es lamentable que no haya un plan de limpieza de la arena, sobre todo el alga que sale expulsada, se entiende que en el mar no es mucho lo que se puede hacer, pero para ser un lugar tan tur√≠stico me parece que deben haber mayores esfuerzos por mantener la arena limpia y no solo de esta, si no que tambi√©n de playa loreto, que en mi opini√≥n personal es mejor playa para ba√±arse,  ya sea por su dimensi√≥n, temperatura del agua y olas. Adem√°s, una de las calles principales se encuentra en proceso de construcci√≥n de veredas, es necesario, pero esta es una mala fecha para efectuar trabajos.
Sobreval√≥rada ( culpa de las estupidas fotograf√≠as de instagram) es una playa solo para ir por el d√≠a.

El lugar es agradable con una bonita vista de playas que no convencen, a pesar de las im√°genes y fotograf√≠as que se revisan de manera previa. Las calles se encuentran pr√°cticamente bloqueadas haciendo muy dif√≠cil trasladarse por sus principales avenidas al estar con mesas de los restaurantes que se encuentran en la zona. Del mismo modo no se encuentran lugares aptos para estacionar e incluso los que podr√≠an ser ocupados para ello se encuentran con prohibici√≥n de hacerlo y guardias municipales atentos a sacar una infracci√≥n.La verdad es que el lugar se recomienda fuera de temporada alta donde podr√° encontrar un lugar agradable para descansar, sin embargo en temporada alta lo m√°s probable es que traiga m√°s dolores de cabeza y momentos desagradables.

la playa es helada y el agua no es turquesa como en las fotos, es un lugar agradable pero no es lo que publicitan para nada, falta infraestructura, la gente en general es amable, los precios est√°n sobre lo normal, esperar√≠a mejores precios para la calidad ... es precio de turista alto... se vacaciona m√°s econimico y es m√°s bonito vi√±a del mal o Valpara√≠so si vives en santiago.

Es una l√°stima la pobre infraestructuraDe la zona.Se promocionan playas las cuales no est√°n se√±alizadas correctamente y rodeadas de horribles caser√≠os tipo campamentos que dan  un ambiente pat√©tico a la zona.Estamos en la costa chilena y hay lugares donde hay apenas 1 o 2 variedades de pescado para degustar.Zona famosa por sus Ostiones....pero NO abundan para el turista.Restaurantes muy caros ..pero lo.peor que no se conducen con la calidad.Lo mismo conos alojamientos.NO RECOMIENDO IR A ESA REGION DE CHILE.
Una playa muy bonita y un ambiente grato, es muy tranquilo y nunca te molesta nadie; ideal para relajarse.

Bah√≠a Inglesa, es un balneario  peque√±o y muy bonito, con aguas c√°lidas y transparentes de color turquesa, con formaciones rocosas  y arena blanca. Es un lugar agradable para disfrutar en el verano.Hay algunos  restaurantes  donde comer; aunque los precios  no son econ√≥micos; de igual forma, vale la pena conocerlo.

Bahia Ingles es un pueblo peque√±o pero lindo, la playa no es tan azul como se muestra en las fotos, tiene un peque√±o morro con restaurantes con diferentes opciones donde se puede pasar un buen rato aunque el servicio en par de ellos no fue tan bueno, en uno se tardaron y en el otro tomaron mal el pedido, pero en general la playa es linda, el pueblo lindo y la comida buena

I spent half a day at this beach a year ago on New Years day.  Arrived at 9 am and by noon the beach was crowded.  Despite my dread of swimming in cold waters I did it anyway!  It's a beautiful place backed by pine forest and protected on one by a yacht club and the other by large white island-like rock outcropping.   I'd post a picture here but that isn't available.  If it's beach you're looking for don't miss this one!
I stayed in the complex that is there and it was the best experience ever. The Bay is so beautiful, with amazing views and sunsets, cozy beach.

Ive had being in many places around the World enjoying of many beaches around the World, tropicals And caribeans but Here at Algarrobo El Canelo And Canelillo Ive found the most beautiful beach around the World in inspite of the Pacific oc√©ano is cooler than others oceans the great temperature of the water became to put stable And settle down your skin your health, your blood And your breath.

Calm water perfect for kid, if you go in low season you will be alone in this half moon of beach, without much noise because to reach there you have to pass a little forest. Specially for a family trip!
You can enjoy a day walking beneath the big threes from the wood up of the beach to then go to it and relax in the sand and water.

The place is very beautiful, the beach is small but the water have a beautiful color. The smell of the forest is very nice and gives you that feeling of being in the nature. You can take beautiful photos there. You can see also an amazing view of the sunset on the top of the hill where there is the forest.

If you are nearby Algarrobo in the summer this is a great little beach to spend a full day.   Parking may be a problem; there are several parking areas that charge per hour (not too bad) but you could also park to the North East behind the woods and walk down to the beach via a small trail through the woods (see enclosed picture).Expect the beach to be crowded.The small bay protects the beach from big waves and the woods behing provide an area where you could rest from the sun if you want. There are several small places where you can buy empanadas, drinks, ice cream, etc. at reasonable prices.Good for small children.From there you can hike to the Islote Pajaros Ni√±os and/or Islote Pe√±a blanca
To many people for confort...good for hiking but to many people...parking is almost impossible and to get here u must have a car...Big hike down the beach...
Exceptional natural beauty formerly, woods extensively cut down to build beach developments. Still remains a charming cove.

Such a lovely beach and worth visiting it. Although I mainly visited El Canelo beach, there are both close to eachother but separated by the Forest (this forest is a municipal park). There are little stores (kioskos) where you can buy food and the tradicional egg bread (pan de huevo) because now the recipe has changed and before, you used to find people selling it at the beach along with the 'Palmeras' (a sweet 'candy', if you can call it like that) but now it's hard to find it but in these two beaches you can so that's amazing! The price of the parking for the cars was $600 pesos chilenos every 30 minutes so it is expensive if you want to spend the whole day at the beach. You can do canopy here (among other activities) and you can explore the forest and obviously take pictures there because it is amazing. One tip: The entrance to these beaches is not difficult but it can be hard for an elderly person so you have to be careful with them so they don't fall because of the irregular path.

Cavancha beach is the second one in the center of Iquique. It is highly recommended for young children and teenagers, and for adult and older people as well. The beach has different option to rent, such as umbrellas, beach and lounge chair, and so on.  You also can buy a soda or a snack. Watch out with the sellers, because there are a lot of them. The only thing that I bought them is sods, because I wasn‚Äôt sure about the quality of cooked food. The best hours to get there is between 10 to 14 and 18 to 20h. Enjoy!

Cavancha is really nice year round as the weather is never too cold. Usually there are plenty of vendors along the sidewalk before the beach selling water, snacks, etc. they're a little over priced, but not ridiculous (if you can get your stuff at the super market beforehand).  I've never had trouble with thieves or anything, although in the summer months (December-February) the beach is ridiculously crowded after lunch and it's probably best to keep your things on you at all times. There are a few surf class tents set up along the north end of the beach and towards the casino there's a little walk up restaurant the Pi√±ita that has juice, completos, desserts for cheap and they accept cash and card. In the summer there are also umbrella and chair rentals, but that's not typical during other months.

We went with my boyfriend with the bicicles fromThe hotel and had a great afternoon. It‚Äôs a bit Indy in October, but a calm beach where to take a bath and lots of sun! You can buy anything to es while being there, we had a Mango Icecream and a mango mojito!
Needs more cleaning and people more educated and politeNice beach , fresh water.... in the city easy to get to
Sunset in Iquique is very beautiful and romantic especially with the lovely sound of Pacific Ocean. The beach is always busy and the surfers starts very early in the morning

This is the place to be on a hot day but get there before lunch in order to get a spot on the beach because it gets busy. There is no need to go anywhere for lunch as there are many people selling all kinds of different foods along the beach. You don't even have to look for them, you'll here them yelling out what they have as they walk along the beach. However, there is an amazing place around the corner where they sell the best empanadas ever called Rincon. They rent umbrellas and chairs for 2000-3000 pesos. All the locals bring there own, for good reason, it gets hot.

The beach is always a wonderful destination, and Cavancha is no exception. Although usually packed in summer (I'd recommend to go on weekdays, during morning hours), it has a smooth swell and the current is very gentle so you can actually swim. The water is rather cold, but with the high temperatures on the shore, it feels refreshing. The sand is smooth and there's plenty around to see, eat, drink and enjoy.

Beach is crowded but perfect for families with kids who want to be in the water. Local vendors keep the food and water supply coming and kids have a great time playing in the sand and water. Parents can relax as the waves are not that high. There are also a couple of shops where you can get food and drinks. Playgrounds to finish off the day

Good beach to come with family and friends. It's nice to swim and you can rent kayaks, paddle boards, body boards etc.There is also beach chairs and sunshade for rent... If you don't have your own. It's 6usd each.In summer it can get a bit crowded, specially after lunch.

Although not quite on Rio de Janeiro standards, one of most scenic city beaches you would hope to find.  The forest of tower blocks testifies to its popularity.  Try to go on a weekday when even in summer, it's not crowded.

Driving from Colchagua valley we drove through vineyards and thick forests of pine and eucalyptus trees passing some small villages along the way and street vendors selling strawberries, water melons and other summer fruits. Pichilemu was packed with traffic and it took us approximately 30 minutes to get through. But Punta de lobos really paid us off. The spot has an amazing view, unbelievable cliffs with various birds flying around, the waves crushing on the rocks, the sandy beach full of people (although it was a bitty chilly) and the surfers in a constant ‚Äúfight‚Äù with the waves. Although it was an overcast day one could only imagine how much more beautiful this place would be on a sunny day!
Great location to surf. Beautiful beach. Lot of things and sports to do. Waves are ok for kids. Just arrive early since parking is a problem.
a nature reserve with world-class waves, wonderful sunsets, windy but sunny place in summer, lots of peace and quiet, marine wildlife, friendly people
Take a colectivo there and explore the area if you aren't staying nearby. It is absolutely beautiful and you can usually catch surfers on the big waves from some peaks above or beaches below.

Regardless if you surf or not, the view is amazing as the cliff and morros are a scene to enjoy.If by any luck you go while the waves are big and breaking behind the morros then you are in for quite a show of surfers taking on huge waves, quite an experience.Take some wine and some snacks and just enjoy the view from the top.
Beautiful Beach to walk for endless miles and miles and meet only few people and enjoy a beautiful view and the sea.

Punta de lobos is a very special place. The spot belongs to the Big Wave surf tour, in winter there are huge swell and there are surfers from meny places. Very cold water and plenty of seafood, its a must for surfers

this beach is a bit far away to pichilemu, a lot of surfers here... no ambulant sellers. the problem here are the showers and toilets, which do not exist. they try to protect the clifs, but a lot of people do not care about this... and also a lot of them are doing their needs between the flora.

Punta de Lobos (Sea Wolf's Point) is the name of the point given to the famous point break outside Pichilemu. Once endangered by real estate investors it was finally bought by surfers and surf organizations and it was declared a Surf Reserve. It offers a big, long, left, consistent and extraordinary wave. The beach, as most of the chilean beaches in the center and the south, is grey - volcanic origin -. Very nice in winter, crowded in summer, and very safe for the children. No coffee shops or whatever - is a reserve, so bring yours! Arrive early and enjoy the wave. Enter by the point straight to the wave or paddle - a lot!- from the beach.  By the way, Punta de Lobos is also a cliff, 50 m above the water, so save some energy to climb back to your car.

A rapidly growing area. Beach very busy at high season. Great for surfers so lots there with accompanying services of hire and teaching.   Quieter areas a bit away from the popular surfing area but not suitable for children to swim due to waves and currents.
The biggest and most popular beach in Vina del Mar.
Playa Renaca is a scenic place with rocks and beach alongside of Pacific Ocean. One can see some impressive buildings inwards. Certainly worth visiting.

We went there for our anniversary and it was a great experience. It is winter time in Chile but it was full of life with plenty of people walking around, playing sports at the beach and a lot of great places to eat. We love it!
We wondered along the beach and very much enjoyed the views all around. The sunset was alas very beautiful and I enjoyed people watching.

My wife, 11 year old daughter and I ventured onward to Vina Del Mar and Renaca, Chile this past Christmas vacation of 2013. Due to rave reviews from friends/expats in the US, we have been talking about visiting here for quite a while. We were sorely underwhelmed by this place in the world, to say the least.Let me begin by asking your reasons for wanting to visit the Vina del Mar area?  If you have to go for business and the company is picking up the tab, well okay. There are worse places. If you are going to discover new culture, fine architecture, great beaches and interesting people, there are 1,000 better places. If you are from the US and taking a family vacation here, willingly, I would ask you to make an appointment with a neurologist.There is nothing about Vina Del Mar, nor Renaca, that even remotely has an edge over the most basic of budget beach resorts at the Jersey Shore. All the beaches, in and around this area from Vina Del Mar all the way up and through Renaca AND beyond, are dumpy, dingy and dirty. Many as well reek of urine, either from the horse drawn carriages, stray dogs or homeless people in and around the area. They're just NOT at all pretty. You walk out on the rocks on the beach at Renaca and find trash and more urine smell, at one time so pungent I nearly vomited. Want to go swimming? We were there on the first day of summer, Dec 21, and it was pretty cold just to walk around. But even in the height of their short summer months, January and February, the water remains Ice-Cap bitter cold due to the area's proximity to the Antarctic.  Beware as well that Vina Del Mar has both a homeless problem, and an incredibly LARGE stray dog issue.  The dogs are all nice and appear to be well fed, but they are literally everywhere; street corners, main roads and especially on the beach.  If you're a dog person you'll love it because they are all very cute and people friendly.  But, they are dogs, and do what dogs do.  Some early mornings you are woken by their territorial stampede as rivaling packs fight for dominance before the traffic gets too bad.  They then calm down until the next sunrise.  This is NOT a family vacation destination, especially if you have US teens.  Understand that Vina Del Mar is VERY third world, and certainly not the mecca of art, culture and beach swimming it is touted to be by people trying to sell you something.  The restaurants are mediocre to good, but in some areas downright awful. There are 2 Starbucks in Vina thank God. You can not get a decent cup of Joe anywhere in this God forsaken country. We ordered a very mediocre lunch in a "caf√©" on Liberdad (one of the main drags) with some Caf√© con Leche. The waiter arrived with instant coffee, a pot of hot water and 2 milk cartons.......and if that wasn't comical enough, one afternoon we ordered omelettes and a cheese sandwich. We all received ham and "cheese of the day" sandwiches and the waiter ran away after placing them on our table. Yes, I do speak pretty good Spanish and ordered correctly, this is just an extremely odd country, and that being said, there is more................A man came up to us as we were walking to dinner one night down 5 Norte, waving his hands at me as he got closer. Each hand contained a large nail. He was insisting I listen to something which sounded like the beginning of a zealous, inspired personal discourse on the death of Christ, and he waved the nails in my face for a moment before we all walked off. It took us a little while after some laughter to try and figure out what he was attempting to say. Did he want to sell us the nails for 1000 pesos? Why not? Various people walk around selling random band-aids, so why not nails? Perhaps he wanted a hammer? Help putting up some new shelving in his home? Nope, it was probably about some religious fanaticism, which breeds a somewhat puritanical and conservative air to the place. My 11 year old daughter wore typical US teen tights and a t-shirt one afternoon and the doorman stopped me, saying she was dressed inappropriately and requested she change. Whattttt?????!!! The same doorman hassled a younger woman for entering the building, wearing a skirt on the short side with boots. This, as an American, I found most bizarre.In a nutshell, we were in Vina Del Mar as an American family for 8 days, and it was 8 days too long. It is old, smelly, and dumpy, lacking in character. One post I read before arriving there compared Vina Del Mar to Barcelona. What a farce! Barcelona is a beautiful European city and Vina Del Mar is a dump; an armpit comparatively to Barcelona.Don't waste your time traveling to Vina Del Mar, nor its neighboring towns like Valparaiso or Renaca, which are even dumpier. Valparaiso is so old, decrepit and run down it looks like a hellish version of San Francisco in 1960 during a garbage pick up strike.

This was a big surprise when we took the bus from vina Del mar to concon and saw the gorgeous seaside of renaca. We were going to to travel to Santiago but stayed an extra day here instead to enjoy the relaxed vibe of renaca

This lovel beach has wonderful views from its rocky shore. The water is very cold but the beaches are beautiful. I saw a lot of sea lions (called Sea Wolfs in Chile) just hanging out there. Explore the lovely town of Renaca and its neighbor Con Con (where you'll find sand dunes to climb, and a lively shopping/eating area in the center of town). Worth a visit if you're staying along the coast!
The renaca beach is very large with huge waves and lots of nice bars. Although it can be quite crowded during the summer months it is a very popular beach

During the summer months of Chile, this beach is jammed packed with people! especially after lunch. There are lots of restaurants along the coast and plenty of people inviting you to parties at night. This beach is great for families, friends, couples, anyone really.
You couldn't find a better beach, very spacious and popular with beautiful waves, summer here is so popular you have trouble finding a parking spot.

Not much to do, but walking along the beach and enjoying an ice cream or coffee by the water is nice. Restaurants are pricier than in Vina del Mar and the food is the same caliber as many cheaper restaurants in Vina del Mar
Popular surfer's beach in the southern part of the city.

if you wanted to be completly disconected from the internet or the technology or maybe also from the city, this is a good option, this heavenly place is loceted between coquimbo and guanaqueros and it is around 20 minutos by car from la serena. This places is prepare to recive tourist, the main attraction is the beach, and the main goal is that the costumers by relaxed during their stay.

A very nice beach on a 15 minutes drive from La Serena. We went there with the people of our AirBnb apartment. It is a way better place than the beach of La Serena, because the way it is shaped. It is a strip of beach in the sea, so the beach is at both sides. The waves are nice to play in or to surf on. If you can reach this beach, you should definitely go.

Nice beach with white sand, clear water and small tides. Kids really enjoy this place.On sundays is incredibly crowded, the road is narrow so you will be in the middle of horribe traffice jam.Perfect for surf.

I came here based on image search: I‚Äôve never been to a beach this packed where I couldn‚Äôt even see the shore. And it was dangerous to go in the water with the amount of people, including the ones on boogie board. I don‚Äôt understand why people pay 4.000 for parking to stay here, when La Serena is only 20 minutes away, less people and cleaner, and 1.800 to park.
Nice spot for lunch and pictures. Spent 3 hours there, the weather was amazing and the beach empty. The water is cold but the view is absolutely gorgeous.

I have to say that it is really beautiful, and paradisaical, but it is overcrowded on January and on February is even worst. Also the place is dirty, I have seen people in the morning cleaning the place, but the same tourists do not take care of this beautiful site. Besides the public toilets are expensive and disgusting. There is others, which costs the same and are better, but you have to walk all around to get there. In my opinion there is a lot to do here, it has the potential if the government or the municipality take care of it.

The view is amazing but very crowded in the peak season. Last time I was there in off season and it was just magical. There are not many places to buy stuff/food. Stay dogs can be a bit scary though, be careful. Nice panoramic view for pics.
This place in awesome and the beach is totally breathtaking. water is crystal clear and the sand is clearly white.

This is a really nice beach to stay for the whole day. We brought umbrellas and day tents so we had some shade. The beach is clean and the sand is wonderful. We explored into the rocky areas and found some amazing shells. Go early so you can claim a good spot.
visit this impressive natural beach, no waves (with a bit of seaweed, nothing to stop swimming) definitely special to cayak, play in the sand, etc.

A bit over an hour from Bah√≠a Inglesa. On your way back you can take a desert sand track exploring Pacific coastline and inland landscapes. Make sure you have enough gas. There are cabins at this beach, but this being a desert, it is a bit desolate to spend a lot of time there.

It's nice enough. Spent a day there but nothing to write home about. Water is a bit dirty compared to nearby beaches. Sand is nice and there are nice wooden parasols to relax under. Some nice stray dogs might come join you.  The main benefit to its big competitor Bahia Inglesa is that Caldera centre is very close and better for a more Chilean feel of restaurant etc.

We visited this beach on a sunny day, the water is blue and white sands, one of the best I have been to. Unfortunately we decided to have lunch in the restaurant above. The told us there is no menu, we both had fish with a scallop sauce and rice, when we got the bill we had been charged $12.000 per dish (7000 for fish, 3000 for sauce and 2000 for rice, what a rip off the food was OK but the service terrible. Take your picnic next time and enjoy the beach.

Chile is not particularly known  for having white sand beaches, but Playa La Virgen is an exception!  It is a unique place, an small cove, with beautiful colours and  unique landscape, where the desert and the Pacific ocean met. If I was going to spend my summer holidays at a beach in Chile again, no doubt I will come back here over and over and over
It was worth it the effort to get there! But go well prepare if its not high season because its only one restaurant and it was closed.
We went to this beach because of all stories.It is a beach with water and sand nothing more.You need a car to acces this beach.I think you can spent your time for othet activities.

Lovely beach, around 1 hour from Bah√≠a, you‚Äôll need a car as there are no buses or etc. you‚Äôll have to pay an entrance fee per car (5000CLP). The place is perfect for camping (15000CLP/night); you can rent cabanas as well (~50-70kCLP/night); there is one restaurant, public WC and shower - nothing else, except the desert:) no cellphone network. Have fun!

We went there with a rental car and it was a nice drive getting to the beach. Only the last 7K was a rough road but doable with a regular car. Parking on top of the hill is free and when we were there (during a weekday) we only had to share this great beach with 2 other persons. We really loved it because of that!
One of the beat beached in the Region III of Chile, with turquoise water and white sand, the beach attracts the distant and weekend travelers!!

It was a beautiful day when I went, but the beach still felt a bit claustrophobic with all the people. The water was colder than further north (or south, surprisingly, near La Serena), and the waves were worse than at the beaches in Parque Nacional Pan de Azucar.

One of the most beautiful places in the middle region of Chile. It‚Äôs a little place not so mainstream but really clean and a perfect one for everyone who want to see something different and beautiful. Must have to see. PS: it‚Äôs a kind of romantic here, good place for couple.

About a 1 hour drive North from Concon. A beautiful small beach town with many trees right up to the ocean. Many beautiful home surrounding cove. A couple restaurants overlooking beach. A few locals shops in town (not on beach). If you want a quiet beautiful beach location - worth a try. Checkout the penguins on your way up ... Isla Pinguino on North end of Cachagua beach.
Great place to see/ visit and see the nature. Well kept beach and walk ways. Nice surroundings. Should stop in if you are in the area.

The water is freezing cold.  No surprise there.  Parking (1,000 pesos an hour - maximum 5000 pesos) can be a challenge unless you arrive early.  The beach is, otherwise, clean.  The people are friendly.  There are amenities, a couple of nice restrooms, and a couple of nice restaurants (one of which requires a bit of walking, but the food was great).  Our overall experience was very positive.

I would have to say this is the Camden, Maine or Malibu, California of the Chilean coast. Quaint, high end homes and beautiful beach. A very relaxed and beautiful area one descends from the hills into. Definitely worth the trip, especially if you go to see the Humboldt Penguins while in the area. Very special memories for those who come from the Northern Hemisphere where there are no penguins!
Beautiful beach with great view and calm ocean, although chilly. It's a place you want to come back again and again, to relax and enjoy family time

It is a nice, small beach without services, one can take a walk, although the promenande is narrow in some part, especially close to a restaurant that invades almost all with tables. One can take a walk on the rocky promenade ("rambla"). Parking is only possible at the parking lot close to the beach.  One-two hour should be enough.

The beach is very beautiful, reminds me of Southern California. We went in mid November, water was very cold. The couple of restaurants at the beach were expensive. The town is beautiful, fancy, safe but we didn‚Äôt see any people at all (on a Saturday)

this stop was a total surprise on my trip. This beautiful and peculiar beach has got a great atmosphere and beautifully shaped rocks that lead to the sea. there's a beautiful hill with a sanctuary on the top that can't be missed

This little beach is very well known in Zapallar, it is quite exclusive.You are not allowed to have picnic, bring your own tent or anything that can ruin its image.Sometimes it gets a little overcrowded in summer time but everything is in order anyhow.There is a life guard during the summer so you can get into the ocean with no problem. The waves can get quite big though and the water is very cold.The beach is beautiful and clean.
